name: Ginger-Chicken Stir-Fry
author: lutzflcat
summary: Stir fries require very little cooking time and you can pretty much use any vegetables you like, but the star of this one is the ginger. This dish is quick and easy to make, but get all of your ingredients together (including mixing the sauce) before you start cooking because everything happens fast! Serve with rice, and garnish with sliced green onions.
ingredients: 1 pound boneless, skinless chicken breasts, thinly sliced
1  red bell pepper, cored and sliced
3 ounces snow peas, trimmed, cut in half
2 ½ tablespoons minced fresh ginger root
directions: Heat 2 tablespoons vegetable oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat
Add chicken to the wok, and stir-fry until chicken is opaque on all sides, about 3 minutes
Heat the remaining 1 tablespoon vegetable oil in the wok
Add bell pepper, onion, and snow peas; stir-fry until vegetables start to soften, 3 to 4 minutes
Whisk together water, hoisin sauce, soy sauce, sherry, ginger, rice vinegar, sesame oil, oyster sauce, sugar, cornstarch, and garlic in a bowl
Add sauce to the wok, stirring constantly until sauce starts to thicken
Add chicken back to the wok, stir, and reheat, 1 to 2 minutes
